title: American_Top_40_1988_May_21st
description:
"Billboard ranks 'em, AT40 counts 'em down."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

A listener wants to know what song in the rock era debuted the highest on the hot 100 and didn't make number one. Casey says this song debuted at number 7, went to number 3, but never got any higher.

Casey tells about the most famous album to have people appear nude on the cover. It caused some who sold it to be arrested for selling pornography.

Terence Trent D'arby is at number 12 with "Wishing Well." Casey tells how he got the confidence to be a singer from his experience boxing.

Two listeners ask, "How many recording acts named for a city have hit number one?" Casey says there were nine, including the band that has this week's number one.
